author.bio: I am pretty moderate, I feel as though that's the easiest way to exercise common sense. I'm probably going to ask for evidence for your claims, or will be critical of baseless bullshit, but that doesn't mean I disagree with you.
author.bio_html: I am pretty moderate, I feel as though that's the easiest way to exercise common sense. I'm probably going to ask for evidence for your claims, or will be critical of baseless bullshit, but that doesn't mean I disagree with you.

body:
I hate Microsoft as much as the next guy, but I also hate fear-mongering and I think we should avoid cynicism here. They bought GitHub, but GitHub didn't really get any worse. In fact, it got better by allowing more private repositories and offering a few more features for free users. Buying a company doesn't mean suddenly they're cleaning house of all the devs and management... It means they're spending $10b to hopefully make more than $10b over the course of the next few years, and have some say over the development of the program, but more likely the business side of things. They're not stupid, and probably won't change the recipe too much. You don't buy a world-class cake recipe and then change the recipe.

That being said, I'd wish Microsoft would just leave me alone.
body_html:
I hate Microsoft as much as the next guy, but I also hate fear-mongering and I think we should avoid cynicism here. They bought GitHub, but GitHub didn't really get any worse. In fact, it got better by allowing more private repositories and offering a few more features for free users. Buying a company doesn't mean suddenly they're cleaning house of all the devs and management... It means they're spending $10b to hopefully make more than $10b over the course of the next few years, and have some say over the development of the program, but more likely the business side of things. They're not stupid, and probably won't change the recipe too much. You don't buy a world-class cake recipe and then change the recipe.

That being said, I'd wish Microsoft would just leave me alone.

body:
You can still download a copy that some internet friends have added some functionality and stuff to. Its still a fantastic and intuitive interface that makes for quick, basic modelling, which can then be sent over to some newer software for cleanup and detailing. I only dabble in 3D myself, but tS was absolutely the best software package out there at the time when it came to being able to quickly model and ease of use. I hope you get some mileage out of it!

http://truespace3d.free.fr/

Nice to see a shout out for trueSpace.  I *loved* that suite, it was the first 3D modeling and animation program I ever owned.  

That Microsoft let it rot was a crime.  So much wasted potential there.

body:
In the wake of the 2020 Woke-ism, I noticed a few things. Many companies will cuck for a buck, kneel and make statements, when no one before really cared about whether they voiced an opinion. In a sea of virtue signaling bullshit from Netflix to Coca-Cola, there are two very prominent examples of companies that refused to get involved in political shit that is not their purview:

1) Microsoft

2) Valve

I gained huge respect for both companies since they refuse to deliberately step into that quagmire.

body:
In a more optimistic view, these are what I expect MS to do it they do end up buying discord.

Since there's already Nitro + Game Pass promos, they might bundle those 2 together

Maybe some kind of Discord VC for Xbox, would be pretty cool?

Microsoft Account requirement will probably come in the future (see Minecraft)

And of course they'll move it off Google Cloud onto Azure (see Minecraft Realms AWS to Azure)

Or they could end up making it free (see github private repos) and taking the route of selling your data or a long term investment of sorts?

body:
Have you never heard of [Embrace, Extend, Extinguish?](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Embrace,_extend,_and_extinguish)  This was their actual business strategy against Linux not so far back. 

They might not want either of them, but they're willing to shit-can both for some reason and pay money for the privilege.

parent.body:
In the wake of the 2020 Woke-ism, I noticed a few things. Many companies will cuck for a buck, kneel and make statements, when no one before really cared about whether they voiced an opinion. In a sea of virtue signaling bullshit from Netflix to Coca-Cola, there are two very prominent examples of companies that refused to get involved in political shit that is not their purview:

1) Microsoft

2) Valve

I gained huge respect for both companies since they refuse to deliberately step into that quagmire.
